Background:

We are developing a project using Eclipse 3.2/CDT 3.1.1 on Windows. Cross-compiling to eCos PowerPC, using a Cygwin based environment. Our project source compromises of over 300 files, and depends on an external library provided by eCos. The project configuration is Executable (Gnu on Windows).

Issue:

We find that the indexer fails to index properly and that the code-assist fails to assist. Looking in the error log I see the following (see attachment for full trace):

java.lang.StackOverflowError

	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.dom.parser.cpp.CPPVisitor.getContainingScope(CPPVisitor.java:673)

	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.dom.parser.cpp.CPPVisitor.getContainingScope(CPPVisitor.java:846)

	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.dom.parser.cpp.CPPClassType.getScope(CPPClassType.java:367)

	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.dom.parser.cpp.CPPClassType.isGloballyQualified(CPPClassType.java:766)

	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.dom.parser.cpp.CPPSemantics.lookup(CPPSemantics.java:1008)

	at org.eclipse.cdt.internal.core.dom.parser.cpp.CPPSemantics.postResolution(CPPSemantics.java:665)

I wonder whether this is failing because of the size of the project? Would the algorithm be better served with an interative approach?
